DOC.HEAD: Lukman Replaced As Oil Minister
Eds: Subroto as one name in 4th graf is cq.
DOC.TEXT: Nigeria's oil minister Rilwanu Lukman, who also serves as OPEC's president, was raised to a new position within the Nigerian government Friday in a major Cabinet reshuffle, an official statement said. The new oil minister is Jubrin Aminu, a surgeon and former education minister. OPEC was expected to take steps to install a new president. No one answered telephones late Friday at the offices of the 13-member cartel. The Vienna-based Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries has an alternate president, Algerian Oil Minister Sadek Boussena. It also has a secretary-general, Subroto, a former Indonesian oil minister. Lukman became external affairs minister, succeeding Gen. Ike Nwachukwu, who was moved back to the army as a general officer commanding a division. Lukman's new position is considered to be a promotion, officials said. Nigeria is forging strong diplomatic relations internationally and Lukman was moved, observers say, because his achievements as OPEC president and his diplomatic skills make him well-suited to the post. Nigerian President Gen. Ibrahim Babangida took over the defense portfolio while Defense Minister Gen. Domkat Bali, Nigeria's longest serving general, was made the new interior minister. Three service chiefs in charge of the air force, navy and the police also were removed and replacements named.
